The Alaka`ina Foundation Family of Companies (FOCs) is looking for a Sr. Data Scientist to support our government customer located at Kirtland AFB in Albuquerque, New Mexico.
Kāpili maintains a repository of over 20,000 films, two million photographs, and 60 million pages of documents dating back to The Manhattan Project. Kāpili Services is charged with making the repository digitally accessible to DTRA deterrent mission researchers in a way that provides knowledge and meaning through the use of Machine Learning (ML), Artificial Intelligence (AI), and data science to return relevant search results to user queries.
The role of the Data Scientist is to collaborate with a team of software developers, systems users (researchers), system administrators, and librarians to develop and implement data structures, ontologies, and user interfaces resulting in ehanced utility of the repository for researchers. The Data Scientist will assist in the design of a feedback loop that offers ways to personalize, optimize, improve, and/or automate services, which use the DTRIAC archives, and ingest behavioral data to improve algorithms and generate knowledge.
DESCRIPTION OF RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develop and implement methods for, and configurations of the Data Lake to support navigation, search, insertion, or extraction of information or files by the government or other performers.
Implement, configure, and perform functional testing of applications.
Leverage the collection, capabilities, and team to perform targeted analyses and studies and to provide dedicated support to missions and end users.
Develop data models for the repository/Data Lake to support machine learning/articifical intelligence algorithms and semantic search utilizing natural language processing.
Collaborate with developers and administrators on implementing, and refining Optical Character Recognition (OCR) technology for automated extraction and cataloguging of metadata from information sources.
Collaborate with a team of software developers, systems users (researchers), system administrators, and librarians to develop an intuitive user interface for researchers (users).
Create documentation or training materials for Project Products.
Support integration or hosting of capabilities or products on government IT systems.
Hold and participate in Gate Reviews.
Other duties as assigned.
REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
5+ years relevant experience working on AI/ML/data science products
Understanding of complex workflows
Security+ Certification or equivalent required (Can be obtained on the job)
Strong Programming Skills in SAS, R, and Python required.
Experience in applying TensorFlow or other Machine Learning libraries
DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
Experience using revision control software such as git
Experience using CI/CD tools such as GitHub
Experience with containerization using Docker, Podman, Apptainer/Singularity
Experience with databases, especially NoSQL and ElasticSearch
Data science experience in NLP
Strong knowledge of human factors and user interface design processes and methodology
Clear written and oral communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively on a small team of data engineers, software engineers, and data scientists developing ML/DL applications on challenging datasets
CITIZENSHIP/SECURITY CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Must be a U.S. Citizen
Must be able to obtain a DoD Secret clearance.

The Alaka`ina Foundation Family of Companies (FOCs) is a fast-growing government service provider. Employees enjoy competitive salaries; a 401K plan with company match; medical, dental, disability, and life insurance coverage; tuition reimbursement; paid time off; and 11 paid holidays.
We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We are proud to state that we do not discriminate in employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. If you are a person with a disability and you need an accommodation during the application process, please click here to request accommodation. We E-Verify all employees.
The Alaka`ina Foundation Family of Companies (FOCs) is comprised of industry-recognized government service firms designated as Native Hawaiian Organization (NHO)-owned and 8(a) certified businesses. The Family of Companies (FOCs) includes Ke`aki Technologies, Laulima Government Solutions, Kūpono Government Services, and Kapili Services, Po`okela Solutions, Kīkaha Solutions, LLC, and Pololei Solutions, LLC. Alaka`ina Foundation activities principally benefit the youth of Hawaii through charitable efforts which includes providing innovative educational programs that combine leadership, science & technology, and environmental stewardship.
For additional information, please visit www.alakainafoundation.com.

Job Description
Data Science Architect
Roles and Responsibilities:
1. Solution Design: Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their goals, requirements, and challenges. Design data science solutions that align with business objectives and address identified problems.
2. Data Integration: Develop data integration strategies to gather, cleanse, and transform data from various sources. Ensure data quality, consistency, and reliability for analysis and modeling purposes.
3. Algorithm Development: Work closely with data scientists and analysts to develop and implement advanced algorithms and models. Optimize algorithms for performance, accuracy, and scalability.
4. Infrastructure Planning: Assess infrastructure requirements for data processing, storage, and analysis. Design scalable and cost-effective architectures, leveraging cloud services and distributed computing frameworks.
5. Technology Evaluation: Stay updated with emerging data science technologies, tools, and frameworks. Evaluate and recommend the most suitable technologies for the organization's data science ecosystem.
6. Collaboration and Leadership: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, engineers, analysts, and business stakeholders. Provide technical guidance and leadership to foster effective teamwork and align efforts towards data-driven goals.
7. Quality Assurance: Establish testing methodologies to ensure the accuracy, reliability, and robustness of data science solutions. Implement monitoring and maintenance processes to identify and resolve issues in production environments.
Required Skills:
1. Strong Data Science Knowledge: Possess an in-depth understanding of data science concepts, methodologies, and techniques, including statistical modeling, machine learning, and data visualization.
2. Technical Expertise: Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Scala. Experience with data manipulation, analysis, and
modeling libraries/frameworks (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
3. Data Integration and ETL: Familiarity with data integration techniques, data preprocessing, and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes. Experience working with databases, APIs, and data pipeline technologies.
4. Architecture and Infrastructure: Knowledge of scalable and distributed computing frameworks (e.g., Apache Spark, Hadoop) and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP). Ability to design architectures that meet performance, scalability, and security requirements.
5. Business Acumen: Understand business goals and challenges. Ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions and communicate complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
6. Problem-solving Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to tackle complex data-related challenges. Ability to identify patterns, uncover insights, and propose innovative solutions.
7. Leadership and Collaboration: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Ability to provide technical guidance, mentorship, and foster a culture of data-driven decision-making.

Overview:
GDC IT Solutions is currently seeking a Data Science Manager in the Carlisle, PA area.
Position Overview:

Position Overview:
The Data Science Manager will report to the Director of Innovation and will be responsible for delivery of innovation acceleration and R&D service improvement through the leadership of the R&D Innovation data science team and digital lab. This will be a high visibility role operating under the general guidance of the EVP R&D and the Director of Innovation with frequent report outs to division and corporate executive staff.

Responsibilities:
Partner with the Innovation Director, R&D scientists, and management team members to identify opportunities for the application of data science to accelerate product and service innovation and improve R&D service to the business.
Leadership and talent development of innovation data science and digital lab team members.
Identification, justification, prioritization, execution, delivery, and communication of data projects that will accelerate innovation and R&D services.
Collaborate with R&D scientists, directors, and managers to identify projects and ensure proper use of data in innovation and support research resulting in the creation of business value. Oversight of data mining, exploration, analysis, and visualization activities.
Establish and continuously improve data science architecture, technology stack, governance, policies, standards, and processes.
Identify and develop partnerships with vendors and other stakeholders to enhance the R&D innovation data science mission.
Advocate and promote data informed innovation through presentations, mentoring and project communication. Contribute to and influence strategic direction and capital deployment for this purpose.
Collaborate with IT, sales, and operations leaders to establish best practices, architecture, policies, and strategy for enterprise data science.
Oversight of the digital innovation lab dedicated for the application of technology in building science and materials innovation.

Minimum Qualifications:
Minimum 2 years of experience in a business environment
Minimum bachelor's degree in data science, data analytics, or related field with -or- Master’s degree or Ph.D. in a quantitative field, such as statistics, computer science, mathematics, or engineering
Minimum 2 years of experience with leadership and talent development with direct reports
Demonstrated team leadership and talent development capabilities.
Demonstrated strong project management capabilities (certifications appreciated).
Strong business acumen and ability to illustrate and communicate business value for data projects. Experience with development of quantitative and qualitative business cases.
Working knowledge of technologies, software, and hardware commonly utilized in a data science environment:
Knowledge of data science languages and toolkits (such as R, Python, Java, NumPy, and MatLab)
Experience with big data analytics technologies (such as Spark and Hadoop)
Experience with data visualization tools (such as D3.js and Tableau)
Expertise in data mining, collection, and machine learning
Working knowledge of statistical models and business intelligence
Ability to store and process unstructured data with databases and machine learning models
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to translate technical details in business language and relate technical concepts to a business impact.
Skilled in organizing and motivating team members to produce high-quality, on-time results.
Demonstrated ability to develop and communicate strategy, vision, and direction and to embrace and facilitate change.
Advanced root cause problem-solving skills and the ability to anticipate and coordinate tactical plans impacting the growth of needs for data services.
A demonstrated ability to leverage existing resources to maximize technology investments.

Job Description
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
Boeing Defense Space & Security (BDS) has an exciting opportunity and immediate need on the P-8 Air Vehicle Program for a Lead Engineering Data Scientist in Tukwila, WA.

This role will be a part of the Air Vehicle Engineering team providing support to the E-7 and P-8 program. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to develop cutting edge tools for multiple programs across the division. This person will be responsible to lead cross-functional teams to determine, define and deploy sophisticated descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, or prescriptive analytic solutions integral to the development, evaluation and production for E-7 and P-8. The role will require the evaluation of stakeholder needs and choosing the best fit methods, defines algorithms, validates and deploys models, while performing the vital data preparation and improvements to models.

Position Key Responsibilities:
Create Maps for all digital data sources and data bases

Investigate and learn about information data sources capabilities and access

Build Indicators Dashboards with the support from engineering management

Identify sources of data to construct predictive and prescriptive models.

Construct predictive and prescriptive models for the engineering community within the P-8 program.

This position is hybrid. This means that the selected candidate will be required to perform some work onsite at one of the listed location options. This is at the hiring team’s discretion and could potentially change in the future.

Basic Qualifications:
Advanced technical education from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry (e.g. Bachelor)

1+ years or more of knowledge and experience in data analysis algorithms (e.g. data mining, statistics, machine learning, natural language processing, text mining, visual analytics) and building Descriptive, Predictive and Prescriptive models

1+ years or more designing and creating new algorithms for the analysis of data to address project requirements, evaluate performance of data analysis algorithms and select and apply algorithms to meet application requirements

1+ years or more applying knowledge of 2D and/or 3D computer graphics to generate data representation and to communicate information

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in product production environment

Knowledge of multiple information technology areas

Systems thinking skills, the ability to understand the big picture and the inter-relationships of all positions and activities in the system, including the impact of changes in one area on another area

Experience communicating to program leadership

Typical Education & Experience:
Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 9 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. PhD+4 years' related work experience, Master+7 years' related work experience). In the USA, ABET accreditation is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard.

This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.

Who we are
American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading global insurance organization. AIG member companies provide a wide range of property casualty insurance in approximately 70 countries and jurisdictions. These diverse offerings include products and services that help businesses and individuals protect their assets and manage risks.
We’re also committed to making a positive difference for our colleagues and in the communities where we work and live. We encourage colleagues to give back to the causes they care most about, supporting these efforts through our Volunteer Time Off and Matching Grants Programs.
Get to know the business
General Insurance is a leading provider of insurance products and services for commercial and personal insurance customers. It includes one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks. General Insurance offers a broad range of products to customers through a diversified, multichannel distribution network.
About the role
The Cyber Portfolio Analytics team delivers data-driven analytics and insights to AIG’s Cyber business leaders. The team supports critical business decisions including underwriting strategy / market positioning, risk appetite and limit setting, capital allocation, portfolio risk management (including catastrophe and clash) and reinsurance / risk transfer.
The team is seeking a Cyber Insurance Data Scientist to build the next generation of AIG’s Cyber Underwriting Model and develop advanced analytics to drive business strategy. The ideal candidate will have deep technical expertise modeling insurance risk, and be highly analytical, collaborative, strategic and a forward-thinker. The candidate will partner with Cyber Security and Cyber Insurance Data Analytics Leads to build an industry-leading analytics platform to drive underwriting at transactional and portfolio levels.
Position Responsibilities:
Serve as the team’s lead technical expert and build analytics and predictive models to drive cyber insurance underwriting decisions. With the Head of Cyber Portfolio Analytics, translate model output into actionable, data-driven underwriting strategies; present findings and recommendations to Cyber Product Leadership to drive cyber underwriting strategy. Lead the technical design, modeling methodology and coding of AIG’s account-level, underwriting risk model; review technical details, test model accuracy and update to reflect the latest trends and threat environment. Work closely with the team’s Cyber Security Data Analytics Lead to assess the quality / lift of external data sets for use in predictive modeling.
Position Requirements:
Mid-level experience in general insurance (preferably Cyber insurance) with focus on building predictive analytics and underwriting models.
Strong expertise in the full model development process – from data wrangling, to data matching, ETL, model building, testing and deployment; highly proficient at coding in one or more languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL, Spark); adept at using data visualization techniques (e.g., R Shiny, Tableau) for exploratory data analysis.
Deep / thorough command of data science and advanced analytics methods (e.g., supervised and unsupervised machine learning) to measure cyber security risk.
Experience working cross-functionally with operations and information technology (IT) to move analytical models from development into a production environment.
Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college or university; Masters degree is strongly preferred. Technical education in a quantitative field (e.g., Actuarial Science, Analytics, Data Science, Engineering, Statistics, etc.).
Demonstrated ability to work across interdisciplinary teams to enhance risk-based decision making.
Strong communication skills (oral and written) and unique ability to translate data and technical insights into logical and compelling business recommendations.
Strong ability to identify, analyze and solve problems as well as the ability to learn rapidly, adapt quickly to change, exercise influence, and manage and prioritize multiple concurrent projects.

NJM Insurance Group (NJM) seeks a Predictive Modeling Analyst to join the Predictive Analytics team at NJM.
About NJM
Founded in 1913, NJM is a regional property and casualty insurer with a national reputation for auto claims satisfaction. NJM offers Auto, Homeowners, Renters, Condo, and Umbrella insurance to individuals in Connecticut, Maryland, New Jersey, Ohio, and Pennsylvania.
NJM also offers Workers’ Compensation, Commercial Auto, Commercial Package and Businessowners insurance to businesses in Connecticut, Delaware, Maryland, New Jersey, New York, and Pennsylvania.
NJM's mission is to provide value-based insurance solutions for the benefit of our policyholders while maintaining the highest levels of service, integrity, and financial stewardship.
About Actuarial
The Actuarial department at NJM provides insight and analysis to help solve complex business problems. The department consists of the following teams: Personal Lines Pricing, Commercial Lines Pricing, Reserving, and Predictive Analytics.
The Role
As a Predictive Modeling Analyst, you will collaborate with colleagues across the company to solve important business problems. Model applications cover all areas of primary insurance operations in Personal and Commercial Lines insurance, including pricing, underwriting, claims, and marketing.
The analyst will be involved in all stages of model execution, including collaborating with business users, creating/testing/refining predictive models, quantifying business benefits, deploying models, and presenting results to technical and non-technical audiences.
This is a hybrid position with some on-site and telecommuting availability each week.
Qualifications
At least 2 years of predictive modeling experience or P&C actuarial experience.
A Bachelor’s degree in Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or related major.
Experience with SAS, SQL, and MS Office.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Job Summary :

Designs, develops and programs methods, processes, and systems to consolidate and analyze unstructured, diverse “big data” sources to generate actionable insights and solutions for client services and product enhancement. Utilizes statistical modeling to make predictions about future outcomes and in multiple scenarios. Evangelizes new ideas / technologies / solutions to gain acceptance from a wide range of audiences. Assigned to the most complex projects.

Job Responsibilities :
Utilizes statistical modeling to make predictions about future outcomes and in multiple scenarios. Evangelizes new ideas / technologies / solutions to gain acceptance at the highest levels of the organization.
Interprets and applies data in the most strategic, most complex analyses, and explains findings to the stakeholders and business audiences to improve products and processes.
Sets the vision for manipulation and analysis of large and complex data sets.
Leads the development and execution of statistical and mathematical analyses to support business decisions enterprise wide or for multiple business functions.
Analyses have the highest level of impact on business operations or outcomes.
Leads the design and development of strategic and highly complex algorithms and statistical predictive models and determines analytical approaches and modeling techniques to evaluate scenarios and potential future outcomes.
Develops and codes software programs, algorithms and automated processes to cleanse, integrate and evaluate large datasets from multiple disparate sources. Identifies meaningful insights from large data and metadata sources
Implements activities that impact the most critical directions of the organization. Typically assigned to the most critical and strategic / complex / high risk undertakings.
Identifies meaningful insights from large data and metadata sources; interprets and communicates insights and findings from analysis and experiments to product, service, and business managers. Determines leading edge technical / business approaches and/or develops the most complex and strategic new technical tools.
IInteracts with product and service teams to identify questions and issues for data analysis and experiments. interprets and communicates insights and findings from analysis and experiments to product, service, and business managers.
Guides and mentors a vast range of audiences. Provides guidance regarding analytical approach and iteration of algorithms.
About Walgreens and WBA :

Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170 year heritage of caring for communities. WBA’s purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. Operating nearly 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving nearly 10 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services, including those that drive equitable access to care for the nation’s medically underserved populations. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high quality products and services in communities nationwide.

Deep knowledge of SQL and Databricks tools, and big data platforms such as Hadoop, Teradata, Synapse and Snowflake
Deep knowledge of open source data science and statistics packages such as Python, R, Spark, etc.
Experience managing complex projects with matrix collaboration between engineers, data scientists, business, vendors, and consultants; experience guiding innovation, model design and performance tuning,
Experience establishing and maintaining key relationships with internal (peers, business partners and leadership) and external (business community, clients and vendors) within a matrix organization to develop strategies that meet department goals within budget and timelines.
Experience presenting findings to all levels of an organization, including the C Suite level.
At least 5 years of experience contributing to financial decisions in the workplace.
At least 5 years of direct leadership, indirect leadership and/or cross functional team leadership.

The Challenge:
For an organization to transform in today’s digital world, it needs to properly collect, store, and organize its data. Effective data management can enable more efficient operations, yielding more growth. As a data architect, you know how to apply your creative-thinking and analytical mindset to help organizations manage their data assets. We’re looking for an experienced data architect like you to deliver leading-edge solutions for an Air Command's Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) mission.
As a data architect, you’ll use your extensive technical expertise to design data architectures to support data science, data engineering, and data visualization. You’ll resolve routine data architecture issues in collaboration with technical teams by providing advice on data warehousing or data mesh methods and approaches, analyzing data architecture business needs, and working with project staff to make decisions and recommendations on future data architecture developments. You will apply a wide range of Big Data and Cloud technologies to propose recommendations for the development of data integration pipelines, scalable data storage environments, Application Programming interfaces (APIs), security procedures, and algorithms used to deliver data faster and more accurately to decision-makers. Along with your team, you will analyze the needs and the environment to ensure development considers the architecture and operating environment as well as future functionality and enhancements. Define and maintain canonical data elements and definitions, data models, policies and business rules, constraints using regular expressions, and reference datasets. You'll develop plans for implementing an enterprise data catalog to identify data quality and data lineage.
This team will deliver world class solutions to implement Artificial Intelligence, Automation and data Augmentation (AAA) and cloud strategy across the ISR enterprise by modernizing the digital environment to meet the requirements of Joint All Domain Command and Control (JADC2), Advance Battle Management System (ABMS), the Sensing Grid, Agile Combat Employment (ACE), the Intelligence Community’s (IC) Augmenting Intelligence with Machines (AIM), Information Environment, and Information Technology Environment strategies.
You’ll also provide mentoring and training for our mission partners, educating them about data architecture, data science, data engineering, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. Your advanced consulting skills and extensive technical expertise will guide clients as they navigate the landscape of data, algorithms, tools, and frameworks. With your drive to establish processes and lead technological innovation, you’ll make a lasting impact on the ISR mission.
Join us. The world can’t wait.
You Have:
3+ years of experience with data architecture, data warehousing, and data governance
3+ years of experience leading business process reengineering, business process assessment, or business architectural development
3+ years of experience developing highly responsive data structures, metadata capture strategies, ontologies, and data dictionaries
3+ years of experience leading data operations teams to develop architecture or extract-transform-load (ETL) data pipelines
3+ years of experience managing an enterprise data catalog for a large organization
Experience with cloud technology supporting scalable data solutions
Knowledge of database development and administration, including process and software
Ability to obtain a security clearance
Bachelor's degree
Nice If You Have:
3+ years of experience managing classified data as well as sensitive data
Experience working on multi-disciplinary Agile teams
Experience working with the Air Force
Knowledge of DoD enterprise data and systems
Knowledge of ISR capabilities, including sensing effects across multiple domains and how these effects can be leveraged in GEOINT, SIGINT, and MASINT sensed environments
TS/SCI clearance
Master's degree
Amazon Certified Solutions Architect or Associate Certification

What You Will Do:
Guidehouse is looking for a Data Analyst/Scientist to increase the usability of a security sector client’s data assets and serve as a strategic advisor to the client to advance data analysis, governance, and management. The candidate will lead the project’s Data Team and support key products including data analyses and visualizations. This role is also responsible for overseeing and supporting data validation and wrangling to maintain an accurate, complete, and up-to-date foreign assistance dataset for the client. He/she will supervise one data specialist and will be responsible for identifying when surge data specialists are needed, acclimating them to tasks, and supervising their performance.
The ideal candidate will speak the language of business and technical teams and act as the bridge between technical team members and non-technical team members and stakeholders. He/she will possess a thorough understanding of business and data strategy; have experience mentoring and managing junior resources; be able to oversee the collection, storage, management, quality, and protection of data; and, will have an ability to communicate the status, value, and importance of data analytics and management to project team members and senior clients.
The Data Analyst/Scientist will be responsible for:
Developing sustainable and reproducible data management and governance processes
Promoting the use of data insights and analytics to enrich business decision-making and key business initiatives, including developing and refining Tableau dashboards and other visualizations for key client stakeholders
Guiding data infrastructure development, deployment, and maintenance to accelerate data informed decision making
Reviewing presentations, graphs and other visualizations, and tables to ensure accuracy and quality
Maintaining data management plans and instructions for operating complex business systems
Ensuring data and information security by integrating and upholding digital security standards
Understanding the client’s organization and culture to improve data governance and management, analytics maturity, and advanced analytics capabilities
Serving as a strategic thought partner to guide business decisions and provide input to data strategies and metrics
Piloting ways to leverage emerging and disruptive capabilities including machine learning, natural language processing, robotics/automation, etc.

What You Will Need:
An ACTIVE and CURRENT SECRET federal security clearance
FIVE (5) years of relevant experience
Bachelor's degree
What Would Be Nice To Have:
5+ years of expertise across multiple areas such as: data science, data management, data governance, data strategy, data wrangling (structured/unstructured, real-time/streaming data, external and non-traditional data sources), and data visualization
1+ years of project, product, or program management
Proficiency in R/Python or other scripting languages
Proficiency in Tableau
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts and insights to senior business leaders and partners in a relevant and actionable manner in writing and verbally
Teamwork and collaboration mindset, interpersonal and relationship-building skills, and ability to lead by influence and example
Demonstrated thought leadership on complex problems with examples of implementing innovative data science solutions and driving outstanding results
Experience with SQL Server and/or Azure
Experience with Salesforce

The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.

You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities.

Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For more than 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection.

We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them. Job Summary:

This position is on the Modeling & Major Initiatives team within Pricing Analytics & Actuarial Services, and is responsible for delivering technical expertise, education, and solutions at the intersection of actuarial, data science, and technology in support of the teams developing Allstate’s insurance pricing solutions. This includes a strong foundation in contemporary actuarial and data science techniques, and an in-depth knowledge of current and emerging technologies supporting analytics, to discover innovative ways to drive efficiency, automation, and accessible advanced capabilities for predictive modeling, data engineering, and actuarial pricing teams. The role works closely with leadership and analysts on actuarial, data science, and technology platform teams to develop, execute, and support innovative solutions to bridge the gap between technology and analytics.

Key Responsibilities:
Develops, stays up to date with, and continuously seeks to improve a deep understanding of the following in the context of possible applications in the system of pricing workflows:
Analytical techniques (predictive algorithms, actuarial methodologies, geospatial, machine learning, optimization)
Analytical software/programming languages (R, Python, Spark, SQL, H2O, XGBoost, Shiny, other emerging software)
Technology infrastructure (linux, k8s, docker, computing techniques, CICD)
Establishes and implements best practices, processes, documentation, and education for efficient onboarding, application, and automation of analytical technologies in pricing teams
Delivers customized technical support and develops tailored tools/solutions to address unique needs of pricing users
Engages with and actively supports actuarial and data science teams, leveraging subject matter expertise to advocate for their needs in collaboration with technology teams on platform solutions and future capabilities
Works closely with technology teams to enhance platform capabilities, drive efficiencies, and resolve issues through effective communication and collaboration
Foresees and addresses potential risks in future platform changes, using systems thinking to develop and execute mitigation strategies, ensuring seamless pricing operations and analytics
Ensures compliance with professional standards, regulatory requirements, and company policies related to the use of technology in pricing
Leads the pricing department through technology transitions by managing a team of analysts responsible for supporting analytical technology use, developing customized solutions and education, enhancing user efficiency and capabilities, and adapting to evolving technological landscapes
Fosters a culture of curiosity, innovation, knowledge sharing, continuous improvement, and servant leadership within team and across the department

Supervisory Responsibilities:
This job does not immediately have supervisory responsibilities but will in the future

Preferred Qualifications:
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in a related field of study such as math/applied math, statistics/applied statistics, computer science/network engineering. Master’s degree is preferred.
5+ years of related experience within the fields of data science/analytics and technology

Certificates, Licenses, Registrations
None

Functional Skills
Technical proficiency in data science and/or data engineering tools: R, Python, SQL, Spark, Bash
Background in or capability to develop an understanding of technology infrastructure (compute frameworks, servers and networking, virtualization)
Problem-solving and analytical skills, with a systems thinking approach to identifying opportunities for optimizing workflows and improving efficiency through technology integration, while considering the interdependencies and potential impact on the broader organizational ecosystem
Advanced project management skills to independently handle concurrent high complexity projects, sometimes across multiple-year time horizons
Advanced communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate and translate across varied disciplines and organizational levels, with a focus on conveying complex technical topics in an understandable manner
Adaptable mindset with the ability to navigate and excel in both tactical and strategic situations, considering existing constraints while pushing boundaries to achieve innovative and forward-thinking solutions for the organization
Strong leadership skills with the ability to mentor, motivate, and develop a team of analysts, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement

job title: Senior Vice President / Senior Data Architect/Manager - Rutherford NJ - Hybrid
job description:
Citi’s Global Functions Technology (GFT) is responsible for delivering Technology solutions to Citi's Global Functions organizations. GFT's mission is to optimize Citi's Technology environment by delivering world class applications, driving standardization of the production environment, reducing complexity, optimizing management of systems supporting global functions such as Compliance, Data, Risk and Finance, and introducing innovative technologies that provide new business capabilities, reduce the technology total cost of ownership, and create a competitive advantage for Citi
Global Risk and Controls Technology (GRCT) within Global Functions Technology supports global functions partners such as Enterprise Risk Management (ERM), Independent Compliance Risk Management (ICRM), Retail Credit Risk, Operational Risk, Model Risk, Internal Audit, O&T Business Risk Control and Citi Chief Administrative Office. Enterprise Risk Management covers Risk Identification, Risk Measurement, Appetite and Limits, Risk Analytics, New Activity Risk Management, Risk Framework and Policy, Enterprise Risk Management Governance.
Job Purpose and Description: The Enterprise Risk Technology Data Engineering Manager, Senior Vice President will work on the build out the Enterprise Risk Data Layer (ERDL), to support the Enterprise Risk Management functions
Be a member of the senior leadership team as The Enterprise Risk Technology Senior Vice President, Data Engineering. This is a Senior Data Engineering Manager level position responsible for accomplishing results through the management of leading teams to establish and implement new or and revised data engineering systems and programs in coordination with the Business, Architecture, and Technology Teams as part of our large digital transformation journey. The overall objective of this role is to design and implement drive next generation, state of the art data analysis systems. You will manage the quality of the engineering teams’ quality of delivery, mentor the technical team, manage technical risk, and translate business needs into digital reality.
Responsibilities:
Manage multiple teams of professional performance evaluations, hiring and disciplinary actions
Lead teams from across the system to analyze data from internal and external systems
Provide expertise as a technical resource to solve complex business problems that translate into data integration and database systems designs
Ensure all deliverables are of high quality by adhering to standards and participating in code reviews
Mentor, support, and manage 100+ person teams
Bring data engineering principles, practices, and phlosophies into all data engineering projects
Create logical and physical data model architecture, data extract/transform/load processes, reporting and analytics solutions
Provide strategic influence and exercise control over resources, budget management and planning while monitoring end results
Influence and negotiate with senior leaders across functions, as well as communicate with external parties as necessary
Assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets
Drive compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency
Effectively supervise the activity of others and create accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards.
Qualifications:
15+ years’ experience in data engineering and end to end automation of data pipelines.
Experience in data modeling and information architecture including experience with Big Data, Relational Databases such as Oracle, columnar data stores, real-time data analytics, streaming and batch processing.
Experience with Java, data APIs, Data Lakes, open shift, reporting and analytics platforms
Comfortable with streaming and big data concepts using design patterns with software like Spark, Flink, Kafka, HDFS, Airflow, Elastic Search, and Ignite
Strong understanding of relational & NoSQL databases, data structures, data science and business intelligence workflows
Experience with large-scale data warehousing and analytics projects, including using AWS and other technologies.
Both technically deep and business savvy enough to interface with all levels and disciplines within the organization
Experience with artificial intelligence and machine learning data toolkits
Experience managing global technology teams.
Working knowledge of industry practices and standards relative to data engineering
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication.
Financial Industry experience in risk management is a plus.
Education:
Master’s degree or higher in Computer Science or related field

NJM Insurance Group (NJM) seeks a Predictive Modeling Analyst to join the Predictive Analytics team at NJM.
About NJM
Founded in 1913, NJM is a regional property and casualty insurer with a national reputation for auto claims satisfaction. NJM offers Auto, Homeowners, Renters, Condo, and Umbrella insurance to individuals in Connecticut, Maryland, New Jersey, Ohio, and Pennsylvania.
NJM also offers Workers’ Compensation, Commercial Auto, Commercial Package and Businessowners insurance to businesses in Connecticut, Delaware, Maryland, New Jersey, New York, and Pennsylvania.
NJM's mission is to provide value-based insurance solutions for the benefit of our policyholders while maintaining the highest levels of service, integrity, and financial stewardship.
About Actuarial
The Actuarial department at NJM provides insight and analysis to help solve complex business problems. The department consists of the following teams: Personal Lines Pricing, Commercial Lines Pricing, Reserving, and Predictive Analytics.
The Role
As a Predictive Modeling Analyst, you will collaborate with colleagues across the company to solve important business problems. Model applications cover all areas of primary insurance operations in Personal and Commercial Lines insurance, including pricing, underwriting, claims, and marketing.
The analyst will be involved in all stages of model execution, including collaborating with business users, creating/testing/refining predictive models, quantifying business benefits, deploying models, and presenting results to technical and non-technical audiences.
This is a hybrid position with some on-site and telecommuting availability each week.
Qualifications
At least 2 years of predictive modeling experience or P&C actuarial experience.
A Bachelor’s degree in Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or related major.
Experience with SAS, SQL, and MS Office.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

We are committed to attracting, retaining and promoting a diverse and inclusive workforce that is fully representative of the diversity that exists in the communities in which we do business.

Would you like to see the impact of your work on the real world? Is hands-on world class engineering and problem-solving part of your passion? Welcome to WBA Tech.

We are a team of technologists, under our visionary CEO Rosalind Brewer, working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, affordable, easier to use, efficient, and patient-focused. Through the user of technology, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the center of everything we do. You will be part of a team that will build the future of a healthcare platform that connects customers with doctors’ offices, hospitals, care centers, pharmacies, insurers and payors. Working for WBA Tech is rewarding because your efforts will make a true difference to customers and patients across the communities we serve in the U.S.

You will be involved in algorithm design, data structure at petabyte scale, imaging and speech processing, artificial intelligence and robotics, infrastructure and network designs at a massive scale.

We look for leaders and individual contributors in front end designers, backend Java programmers, Linux engineers, network engineers, software and algorithm designers (remember the big O notation?), AI implementers, image processing engineers, database designers (SQL and NoSQL), messaging engineers and security engineers with knowledge at protocol level.

WBA is #18 on the Fortune 500 list and our company purpose is more joyful lives through better health.
Job Summary :

Seasoned, experienced professional with a full understanding of area of specialization, who will perform and implement activities that impact components/ processes of specified functional areas of the Walgreens Digital/Online application. Anticipates and prevents problems and roadblocks before they occur. Typically assigned to important / complicated undertakings. Implements activities that generally impact important components / processes of the work of own unit / team / projects of the platform operation in an Agile environment.
This role is developing design skills, but has a comprehensive understanding of the organization's current software application and tools. Has in-depth knowledge of programming languages important to the organization and is proficient with them. Receives work in the form of short- and mid-term assignments that regularly require the application of independent judgement. Mentors less experienced members of the team.

Job Responsibilities :
Plans, designs, develops and tests software systems or application for the software enhancements and new products including cloud-based or internet-related tools. Writes code that meets specifications, typically for large and highly complex software programs and systems. Develops software applications and tools. Participates in software design.
Writes code that meets specifications for large and highly complex software programs and systems.
Develops software applications and tools. Participates in software design.
Develops software applications and tools using Agile development methodologies.
Delivers software features with exceptional quality, meeting designated release plan and delivery commitments.
This role is assigned to important / complicated undertakings.
Contributes to and participates actively in the design, architecture and build phases, to aim at producing high quality deliverables, working with existing architects where appropriate. Participates in the evaluation of compatibility of programs with existing communications hardware and software features.
Interacts with internal and external peers and manages to exchange complex information related to areas of specialization. Work closely with other team members in guiding software architecture and technology decisions.
Demonstrates proficiency in most areas of the professional function and in-depth specialization in some. Work on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors. Anticipates and prevents problems and roadblocks before they occur.
Networks with senior internal and external personnel in own area of expertise to exchange semi-complex information related to assigned activities.
Developing professional expertise, applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues
Developing design skills. Has a comprehensive understanding of the organization's current software applications and tools. Has in-depth knowledge of programming languages important to the organization.
Resolves a wide range of issues in creative ways.
Developing design skills and has a comprehensive understanding of the organization's current software applications and tools. Has in-depth knowledge of programming languages important to the organization.
Anticipates and prevents problems and roadblocks before they occur.
Mentors less experienced members of the team.
About Walgreens and WBA :

Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170 year heritage of caring for communities. WBA’s purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. Operating nearly 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving nearly 10 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services, including those that drive equitable access to care for the nation’s medically underserved populations. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high quality products and services in communities nationwide.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree and at least 4 years of experience in Engineering, Software Engineering or similar field OR High School/GED and at least 7 years of experience in Engineering, Software Engineering or similar field
Experience writing code for moderately complex applications
Experience with programming languages for online applications, microservices or mobile applications
Experience designing/building moderately complex applications/automation
Experience writing automation test or deployment scripts
Experience creating/coding scripting solution to fix moderately complex problems
Experience identifying operational issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve problems
At least 2 years of experience contributing to financial decisions in the workplace
At least 2 years of direct leadership, indirect leadership and/or cross-functional team leadership
Willing to travel up to/at least 5% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state).

Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or related field
Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, EventHub etc.
Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases
Experience with ETL tools: Microsoft ADF and DB, Talend
Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc

Seize your opportunity to make a personal impact as a Senior Data Scientist supporting The United States Postal Service (USPS) Office of Inspector General (OIG). GDIT is your place to make meaningful contributions to challenging projects and grow a rewarding career.

At GDIT, people are our differentiator. You will help ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. You will have a primary focus on engineer data analytic solutions, including prototyping, proof of concept, and full implementation. Candidates will evaluate, assess, document, and test data security and continuity of operations for systems and programs. There is an expectation that candidates will be experienced in ensuring compatibility between equipment and software, analyzing operation/systems requirements, supporting design reviews, and presenting technical briefings. Best candidates will be capable of supporting all aspects of AI/ML projects along with consulting, development, and implementation activities of ML Ops end-to-end solutions.

HOW A SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST WILL MAKE AN IMPACT
Coordinate with staff and customers to identify business and technical requirements
Produce written documentation and artifacts for all work completed, including the translation of user requirements into technical designs
Assist the agency in the development of programming and visualization solutions
Troubleshoot and provide support on existing projects or application efforts
Understand the concepts supporting relational databases, data warehousing, data governance, data access, data quality and related areas
Skill applying analytical techniques, methods, and processes to business problems demonstrated through a history of accepted modeling and analyses that resulted in meaningful business impact. These include working with unstructured or structured data and converting those data sets using a variety of analyses such as optimization, simulation, classical and spatial statistics, and/or programming languages
Skill using advanced analytic techniques such as machine learning, natural language processing, robotics process automation, artificial intelligence, text and/or data mining, and statistical and mathematical methods
Work as RISC liaison to CIO for server/system issues related to AWS and Azure
Strong writing and documentation skills to capture collection of source data, methodology from business rules, and visualization deployment from a myriad of sources and interactions with various stakeholders
Perform analysis of data for Extraction, Transformation, and Load (ETL) strategies, pattern recognition, and application of analytical tools
Review, analyze, and modify existing products including coding, debugging, testing, and documenting
Provide guidance to coworkers on business and technical issues affecting projects, such as data access, data quality, storage capacity, and analytic tools and software
Assist with training and conference development which may include presentations to large audiences
Ability to facilitate between business owners and end-users who need to communicate with database administrators and traditional IT support staff
Ensure that quality/security guidelines are followed
Strong relational database and querying languages experience
Understand and follow a software development lifecycle (analysis, design, development, coding, testing, debugging, and documenting)

WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO SUCCEED:

Education:
BA/BS in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Analytics, or related field

Certification(s):
Professional Certification(s) in a related field of data science and/or data analytics disciplines (preferred)

Required Experience:
8+ years' experience and skill writing coding languages (such as SQL, Python, R, SAS, and Java Scripts)
3+ years' experience working with projects involving machine learning, natural language processing, robotics process automation, artificial intelligence, text and/or data mining, as well as statistical and mathematical methods
At least 1+ year experience working with AWS or Azure services such as Databricks, Data Factory, and Data Lake

Required Technical Skills:
Expert proficiency in common data science tools, including:
Scripted languages (such as SQL, Python, R, and Java Scripts), Integrated Development Environment and analytics platforms, open-source solutions, commercial off-the shelf tools and hardware-based capabilities to support the data analytic development process and creating models, dashboards, and reports
Knowledge and experience in:
Using advanced analytic techniques such as machine learning, natural language processing, robotics process automation, artificial intelligence, text and/or data mining, and statistical and mathematical methods
Using business intelligence applications and reporting technologies/methodologies including Data Analytics Expressions (DAX), data Mash-up(M), and Microsoft Power Platform (e.g., Power BI, Power Apps, Power Automate, etc.)
AWS or Azure Services, including Databricks, Data Factory, and Data Lake
SAS Visual Analytics, SAS Enterprise Guide, SAS Studio, Office Analytics, and other SAS tools
Knowledge of ODBC connection strings, and other external data source connection protocols
Knowledge of Extraction, Transformation, and Load (ETL) strategies, pattern recognition, and application of analytical tools

Security Clearance Level:
Ability to obtain a Public Trust
The security clearance for this program requires the selected candidate to have resided in the US for the past five years. The selected candidate cannot have left the country for longer than 90 consecutive days and no more than 180 cumulative days

Required Skills and Abilities:
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Must be able to work effectively in a team environment.

Location:
Primary location in Arlington, VA with a hybrid work schedule (i.e., commuting one day a week or twice in a two-week period)

GDIT IS YOUR PLACE:
401K with company match
Comprehensive health and wellness packages
Internal mobility team dedicated to helping you own your career
Professional growth opportunities including paid education and certifications
Cutting-edge technology you can learn from
Rest and recharge with paid vacation and holidays

Overview:
The Sr. Data Analyst will focus on analyzing healthcare financial data and building reports that provide insights into the operational and financial health of the business. This is a technical and very data-driven position that will work closely with Business Users, Billing, Finance and Technology teams. The optimal candidate has background in financial data analysis related to healthcare claims management. Duties include:
Gather and Document business and functional requirements and specifications
Work closely with Offshore developers and onshore stakeholders/user and coordinate on deliverables
Take ownership of quality and consistency across all reports and metrics, and help consolidate
Analyze data, build database tables, stored procedures and reports to deliver requested information
Help define key metrics that would provide more insight and gain approval for development
Understand business processes and map them to underlying data elements
Identify data gaps and issues between Healthcare system and databases and resolve them
Automate and streamline delivery of reports and alerts
Document reports, definitions, and tasks due, escalate issues and communicate progress
Collaborate with other analysts and developer in helping establish standard practices
Work across different business units to identify data dependencies and set up necessary controls
Build and maintain strong relationship between different business units to help collaborate
Assist with other analysis, development, QA as needed
Responsibilities:
Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities

Design and conduct ongoing analysis of business unit profitability, cost structure, capital deployment and regulatory compliance. Incorporate industry specific metrics into analysis and reports. Provide results, issues, trends, and insights to management.
Prepare monthly comparison analysis of actual results with plans and forecasts.
Maintain and promote a strong safety culture and follow all safety policies, procedures, and regulations. Identify and communicate workplace hazards and correct or seek assistance in correcting unsafe actions or conditions.
Explore large, diverse data sets from the healthcare industry.
Sample and stratify the data, transform the data, create new views of the data, and perform feature selection.
Advance statistical methods to identify interesting, meaningful sub-populations in the data.
Understand the business context of these advanced analytics opportunities.
Evaluate the models and visualize the results.
Data analytics and data mining.
Other duties as assigned
Qualifications:
Education and/or Experience

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS
4+ years analyzing data and writing queries/stored procedures in SQL Server
4+ years working with financial data associated with Healthcare Claims
2+ years building reports and dashboards in PowerBI
1+ years building reports in Excel
Ability to quickly grasp and articulate dependencies between processes and data
Strong ability to analyze data and pay attention to detail
Excellent communication, organizational and time management skills
Takes initiative and can manage and complete multiple concurrent projects in a timely manner

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combinations of education and experience
Experience leading projects and/or a small team
Experience working with offshore teams

Skills/Specialized Knowledge

Walgreens, one of the nations largest drugstore chains, is included in the Retail Pharmacy USA Division of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc., the first global pharmacy led, health and wellbeing enterprise. Approximately 400 Walgreens stores offer Healthcare Clinic or other provider retail clinic services. As the neighborhood drugstore and retailer, our goal is to make health and happiness simpler, easier and within reach. And we remain a trusted wellness provider offering convenient access to important health services, such as immunizations and an array of pharmacy services that can help patients improve their health. To our team members, Walgreens represents a unique opportunity to excel in their careers in a welcoming and inclusive environment. As a Junior Data Scientist, you will help support the Senior Data Scientist in analysis and research, and machine learning modeling that is underpinning new and current products. Additionally, the Junior Data Scientist will support the Data Engineer in building new data pipelines including new ETL functions.

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelors degree in STEM field using applied statistics and/or machine learning with two plus years of experience.

Strong statistical and mathematical skills: You should have a strong understanding of statistical concepts such as probability theory, hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and machine learning algorithms.

Proficiency in programming languages: You should be proficient in at least one programming language, such as Python or R. You should also be familiar with SQL for data querying and manipulation.

Data manipulation and visualization: You should be able to clean, manipulate, and transform data using tools like pandas and numpy in Python or tidyverse in R. You should also be able to create effective data visualizations using libraries such as Matplotlib or ggplot2.

Familiarity with machine learning algorithms: You should have a basic understanding of machine learning algorithms such as linear regression, logistic regression, decision trees, and clustering techniques.

Communication skills: You should have excellent communication skills, including the ability to clearly explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Collaboration skills: The ability to work collaboratively with other team members, including data engineers, data analysts, and business stakeholders, can be beneficial for you in delivering successful projects.

Problem-solving skills: You should be able to identify and solve complex problems, often with incomplete or imperfect data.

Attention to detail: You should have excellent attention to detail, ensuring that your data analysis is accurate and error-free.

Continuous learning: You should be willing to learn new skills and keep up with the latest industry trends and developments.

Nice-to-have skills and Experience

Experience with AGILE/SCRUM/JIRA.

Experience with the AWS cloud platform.

Understanding of deep learning algorithms.

Domain expertise: Having domain expertise in criminal justice, crime analysis and/or risk calculation.

Knowledge of data ethics and privacy.

Project management skills scoping, planning, and executing.

Location: Remote

Purpose of this role:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Scientist to join our team. As a Data Scientist, you will be responsible for leveraging your expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning to extract actionable insights and drive data-driven decision-making across the organization. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives, identify data sources, perform advanced analytics, and develop predictive models to optimize processes and enhance performance.

Data Analysis: Explore and analyze complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations, and generate actionable insights that contribute to business growth and optimization.
Statistical Modeling: Design and develop statistical models to solve business problems, including regression analysis, time series forecasting, clustering, classification, and recommendation systems.
Machine Learning: Apply machine learning techniques, such as supervised and unsupervised learning, natural language processing, and deep learning, to build predictive models and automate decision-making processes.
Feature Engineering: Identify and engineer relevant features from diverse data sources to enhance the predictive power and accuracy of models.
Data Visualization: Communicate findings and insights effectively through data visualizations, dashboards, and reports to stakeholders, enabling data-driven decision-making at all levels of the organization.

Model Deployment and Monitoring: Implement and deploy data science models into production environments and monitor their performance to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Continuous Learning: Stay up to date with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning, and related fields, and proactively apply new methodologies and techniques to enhance the organization's data science capabilities.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Experience in the Healthcare and/or Revenue Cycle Management domain is desirable but not required.
Proven experience as a Data Scientist, utilizing data analysis and statistical modeling techniques to derive actionable insights.
Strong programming skills in languages such as Python or R for data manipulation, analysis, and model development.
Proficiency in SQL and experience working with relational databases.

Utilize various data sources to conduct descriptive and diagnostic analyses, including A/B tests, to derive insights and inform business decisions
Leverage big data cloud computing resources to design, test, and implement innovative analytical solutions that measure, predict, and influence business outcomes
Integrate a variety of data sources (e.g., retail point-of-sale, shipments, financial, consumer, geospatial) to proactively evaluate and identify consumer marketing business opportunities
Lead the application of advanced analytical methods, including machine learning and statistical techniques, to develop consumer-centric insights
Synthesize and effectively communicate analyses, including A/B test results, to business leaders, enabling data-driven decision making
Collaborate with brand marketing, in-market and digital activation, and data engineering teams to define, scope, and deliver data-driven solutions aligned with multiple priorities
Support the productionalization and deployment of analytical model solutions while ensuring their ongoing tracking, maintenance, and efficacy

What we want you to have:
Bachelor's degree in Decision Science, Advanced Analytics, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or related field
Relevant post graduate study or 1- 2+ years of progressively responsible work experience; CPG experience preferred but not required
Ability to independently conduct complex data manipulation, model analyses, and synthesize results
Firm grasp of basic statistical/economic principles and a general understanding of advanced analysis techniques
Demonstrated knowledge of SQL and Python programming languages; familiarity with Apache Spark & Databricks preferred
Experience conducting A/B tests or with statistical methods involved in hypothesis testing and significance analysis
Knowledge of machine learning or causal inference techniques and their practical applications
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Curiosity, attention to detail, and a sense of urgency in exploring data and solving business challenges
Ability to collaborate effectively in cross-functional teams and manage multiple priorities.

In addition to the opportunity to apply and develop your skills toward key business priorities, we offer excellent relocation compensation packages that include a compelling base salary, comprehensive health/vision/dental insurance, and participation in our incentive compensation and deferred profit-sharing programs.

This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship
Company Overview: Altria has a leading portfolio of tobacco products for U.S. tobacco consumers 21+. Our tobacco companies – which have been the undisputed market leaders in the U.S. tobacco industry for decades – include some of the most enduring names in American business. In combustibles, we own Philip Morris USA, the maker of Marlboro cigarettes and John Middleton, manufacturer of Black & Mild cigars. Our smoke-free portfolio includes ownership of U.S. Smokeless Tobacco Company, the maker of Copenhagen and Skoal, and Helix Innovations, the maker of on! oral nicotine pouches. Additionally, we have a majority-owned joint venture with JT Group, Horizon Innovations, for the U.S. marketing and commercialization of heated tobacco stick products. Through a separate agreement with Philip Morris International, we have the exclusive U.S. commercialization rights to the IQOS* Tobacco Heating System® and Marlboro HeatSticks® through April 2024. Our equity investments include Anheuser-Busch InBev SA/NV, the world’s largest brewer and Cronos Group, a leading Canadian cannabinoid company. Each Altria company is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing individuals with criminal records, including formerly incarcerated individuals and individuals with conviction records, a fair chance at employment. Learn more about Altria at www.altria.com and follow us on Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn

job title: Senior Vice President / Senior Data Architect/Manager - Rutherford NJ - Hybrid
job description:
Citi’s Global Functions Technology (GFT) is responsible for delivering Technology solutions to Citi's Global Functions organizations. GFT's mission is to optimize Citi's Technology environment by delivering world class applications, driving standardization of the production environment, reducing complexity, optimizing management of systems supporting global functions such as Compliance, Data, Risk and Finance, and introducing innovative technologies that provide new business capabilities, reduce the technology total cost of ownership, and create a competitive advantage for Citi
Global Risk and Controls Technology (GRCT) within Global Functions Technology supports global functions partners such as Enterprise Risk Management (ERM), Independent Compliance Risk Management (ICRM), Retail Credit Risk, Operational Risk, Model Risk, Internal Audit, O&T Business Risk Control and Citi Chief Administrative Office. Enterprise Risk Management covers Risk Identification, Risk Measurement, Appetite and Limits, Risk Analytics, New Activity Risk Management, Risk Framework and Policy, Enterprise Risk Management Governance.
Job Purpose and Description: The Enterprise Risk Technology Data Engineering Manager, Senior Vice President will work on the build out the Enterprise Risk Data Layer (ERDL), to support the Enterprise Risk Management functions
Be a member of the senior leadership team as The Enterprise Risk Technology Senior Vice President, Data Engineering. This is a Senior Data Engineering Manager level position responsible for accomplishing results through the management of leading teams to establish and implement new or and revised data engineering systems and programs in coordination with the Business, Architecture, and Technology Teams as part of our large digital transformation journey. The overall objective of this role is to design and implement drive next generation, state of the art data analysis systems. You will manage the quality of the engineering teams’ quality of delivery, mentor the technical team, manage technical risk, and translate business needs into digital reality.
Responsibilities:
Manage multiple teams of professional performance evaluations, hiring and disciplinary actions
Lead teams from across the system to analyze data from internal and external systems
Provide expertise as a technical resource to solve complex business problems that translate into data integration and database systems designs
Ensure all deliverables are of high quality by adhering to standards and participating in code reviews
Mentor, support, and manage 100+ person teams
Bring data engineering principles, practices, and phlosophies into all data engineering projects
Create logical and physical data model architecture, data extract/transform/load processes, reporting and analytics solutions
Provide strategic influence and exercise control over resources, budget management and planning while monitoring end results
Influence and negotiate with senior leaders across functions, as well as communicate with external parties as necessary
Assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets
Drive compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency
Effectively supervise the activity of others and create accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards.
Qualifications:
15+ years’ experience in data engineering and end to end automation of data pipelines.
Experience in data modeling and information architecture including experience with Big Data, Relational Databases such as Oracle, columnar data stores, real-time data analytics, streaming and batch processing.
Experience with Java, data APIs, Data Lakes, open shift, reporting and analytics platforms
Comfortable with streaming and big data concepts using design patterns with software like Spark, Flink, Kafka, HDFS, Airflow, Elastic Search, and Ignite
Strong understanding of relational & NoSQL databases, data structures, data science and business intelligence workflows
Experience with large-scale data warehousing and analytics projects, including using AWS and other technologies.
Both technically deep and business savvy enough to interface with all levels and disciplines within the organization
Experience with artificial intelligence and machine learning data toolkits
Experience managing global technology teams.
Working knowledge of industry practices and standards relative to data engineering
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication.
Financial Industry experience in risk management is a plus.
Education:
Master’s degree or higher in Computer Science or related field
